args.natural_language_statement: For $1\le i\ne j\le n$ and $t\in \mathbb{R}$, let $E_{ij}(t)$ denote the elementary matrix obtained from the identity by adding $t$ times row $j$ to row $i$. Prove that $E_{ij}(t)\in \mathrm{SL}(n)$.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Matrix
open LinearMap

/-- For $1\le i\ne j\le n$ and $t\in \mathbb{R}$, let $E_{ij}(t)$ denote the elementary matrix obtained from the identity by adding $t$ times row $j$ to row $i$. Prove that $E_{ij}(t)\in \mathrm{SL}(n)$. -/
theorem add_row_to_row_sln_extracted [DecidableEq n] [Fintype n] [CommRing R] (i j : n) (t : R) :
 Matrix.AddRowToRow.toSL n R i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup n R := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

/-- E_ij(n) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
def E_ij (n : ℕ) (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
  (Matrix.identity (Fin n)).update i j t

/-- Placeholder: E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
 theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
  E_ij n i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Matrix

/-- E_ij(t) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
def E_ij (n : ℕ) (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
  fun p q =>
    if p = q then 1 else
      if p = i then
        if q = j then t else 0
      else
        0

/-- Placeholder: E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
  E_ij n i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
  sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Matrix

/-- E_ij(t) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
 def E_ij {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
   fun p q =>
     if hdiag : p = q then 1
     else if h' : p = i ∧ q = j then t else 0

/-- Placeholder: E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
 theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
   E_ij i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
   sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Matrix

/-- E_ij(t) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
 def E_ij {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
   fun p q => if p = q then 1 else if (p = i) && (q = j) then t else 0

/-- Placeholder: E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
 theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
   E_ij i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
   sorry

import Mathlib
open Matrix

/-- E_ij(t) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
 def E_ij {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
   fun p q =>
     if hdiag : p = q then 1
     else if hpi : p = i then
       if hqj : q = j then t else 0
     else 0

/-- Placeholder: E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
 theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
   E_ij i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
   sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib
open Matrix

/-- E_ij(t) is the matrix obtained from the identity by adding t times row j to row i. -/
 def E_ij {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (t : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
   fun p q =>
     if hdiag : p = q then 1
     else if hpi : p = i then
       if hqj : q = j then t else 0
     else 0

/-- E_ij(t) has determinant 1, hence lies in the special linear group -/
 theorem E_ij_in_SL {n : ℕ} (i j : Fin n) (hij : i ≠ j) (t : ℝ) :
   E_ij i j t ∈ Matrix.SpecialLinearGroup (Fin n) ℝ := by
   sorry
